title: Research
text: I employ a variety of methods (e.g. surveys, lab experiments etc.) to investigate the cognitive, biological and economic foundations of socio-political attitudes and beliefs. Here are some of my interests

title: Research
text:
Political ideology and intergroup relations
This area of study seeks to understand how political beliefs and values influence interactions between different social, ethnic, and political groups, as well as the consequences of these interactions for social cohesion and conflict.

title: Research
section: Threat perception, risk-taking and negativity bias
text:
Threat perception, risk-taking and negativity bias
This aread seeks to understand how Threat perception, risk-taking negativity bias shape human behavior, with a particular focus on the broad applications for understanding intergroup relations, anti-democratic behaviors, and political beliefs.

title: Research
section: The antecedents and consequences of conspiracy beliefs
text:
The antecedents and consequences of conspiracy beliefs
This area of study seeks to understand the factors that lead individuals to adopt conspiracy theories and the impacts these beliefs have on behavior and society.
